benchmark_details.name: MOMENTS (Multimodal Mental States)
benchmark_details.overview: MOMENTS is a comprehensive benchmark designed to assess the Theory of Mind capabilities of multimodal large language models through realistic, narrative-rich scenarios presented in short films. The benchmark includes over 2,300 multiple-choice questions spanning seven distinct Theory of Mind categories.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To support the development of socially intelligent multimodal agents and assess current modelsâ€™ Theory of Mind in realistic, socially grounded scenarios.
purpose_and_intended_users.limitations: The benchmark uses a multiple-choice QA format, limiting analysis of lower-level behavioral cues. Additionally, it relies on static video data which does not account for dynamic interactions.

data.source: Short films sourced from the SF20K dataset (YouTube channel Omeleto).

methodology.calculation: Metrics are calculated based on the percentage of correctly answered questions out of the total questions.
methodology.interpretation: Higher accuracy indicates better performance in understanding Theory of Mind through context.
methodology.validation: Piloted with multiple rounds of quality checks and peer reviews.

targeted_risks.harm: Ensuring the dataset is used ethically to mitigate risks related to manipulation and deception.

ethical_and_legal_considerations.privacy_and_anonymity: Questions do not contain personally identifying information.
ethical_and_legal_considerations.data_licensing: CC BY-NC-SA 4.0 license for academic research purposes only.
